titleStmt.title: England still freshly lamenting the losse of her King, with several of her dearest children, vvhich have been beheaded, hanged, and shot, by O. Cromwel, and the Long-Parliament in a brief collection of the remarkable passages that have happened to this land, from the year 1640, to this present year 1660 / by W.P. Gent.
titleStmt.author: W. P., Gent.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
